Name: Mummer's Wish
Description: You rescued a weak Aria Mummer near Septimont City. It entrusts you with four Melody Boxes, each carrying a piece of music. What story might they tell?
QuestDesc: You rescued a weak Aria Mummer near Septimont City. It entrusts you with four Melody Boxes, each carrying a piece of music. What story might they tell?

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello, {Male=mister;Female=miss}! Are you the Champion of the Great Agon?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hooray! A Champion like you can definitely save it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... let me see... Yep, you're definitely the Champion! It's a face everyone in Septimont would recognize!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I saw a bunch of TDs bullying a poor Aria Mummer just outside the city gates!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, can you help it? I'll pay you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Umm… you can have my allowance! And this coupon from a juice bar! I-I can also weave little animals out of grass…

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll help you. But you can keep those.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really?! Thank you so much! I'll be cheering for you by the gates!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see it! Right over there!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Aria Mummer you rescued seems rather weak, but it greets you nonetheless.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What are you doing out here alone? Where's your master?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Need your help here, Abby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Roger. Whatcha doing here all by yourself? How come your master's not around?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mm-hmm... Gotcha. It says it's on a delivery run from the Hunter's Den.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Its frequency is already weak, and those TDs coming at it only made things worse... Also, our Mummer friend here is set on delivering these Melody Boxes before heading back to the Resonance Nexus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …It's its last wish. Whaddya say we lend a hand, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright then. We'll be with you till the very end, don't you worry!

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello... Can I help you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... Aren't you the Champion of the Great Agon? I'm a huge fan!

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you really here to see me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Aria Mummer hands the sorrowful boy a Melody Box and begins to play a song.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've never heard this one before... The melody sounds fresh, and it's got strong drumbeats... I like it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Melody Box is for the person who lives here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The person... who lives here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... Maybe it's for my big brother.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …He passed away during the recent High Tide. His team was hit hard. They didn't even find his weapon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, don't be… I-I'm not that sad about it, really!

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My brother… He was a great man, becoming a Gladiator at a very young age. I've always been proud of him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Uncontrollable sobs*

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You comfort the sorrowful boy. It took some time for him to regain his composure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for this song.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you know its composer? I'd like to tell them thank you...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was composed by the master of this Aria Mummer, but we don't know who they are. All we know is this Echo came from the Hunter's Den.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm… It's hard to find an Aria Mummer in Septimont, especially in the Den. I only see the Ragunnesi with them. Gladiators don't take Echoes that can't fight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Buuuuttt… I remember seeing a bard with an Aria Mummer a few years ago, back when my brother was about to go to the Hunter's Den.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She sang many songs. There was a lullaby that was all right, as for the others… well…

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They were so bad. I could make better music by blowing on a leaf.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Do you think she could compose a song like this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not likely. I still remember how terrible her music was.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, thank you... and the unknown composer of this song.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because of you, I now know I'm not the only one who still remembers my brother.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I get older, I'll become a brave Gladiator just like him and protect Septimont!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's the spirit. You'll definitely make it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eh? A talking Echo?

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wha-?! Stop joking around, you can't be serious.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa! I thought you were just mumbling to yourself. You have a talking Echo with you. No wonder you took on this Aria Mummer's request.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why do you sound so surprised? I thought Echoes are respected here in Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, to me, Echoes are like home appliances gifted by the Sentinel... You wouldn't really know what they're saying even if they have a mind of their own, would you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not an appliance. Here, witness my SUPER SMASH!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, please, go easy on me—

Dialogues.Speaker: Sorrowful Boy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe... cause of you, I feel better now.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Glad to hear it. Till we meet again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're… the Champion? Looking for my Ma? She just passed away recently.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's nothing... I don't really care anyway...

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What the...? Did this Echo just pat me on the head? How rude!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry. We're just helping it deliver a song to someone who lives here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A song? Heh, weird. Well, since I'm the only one left in my family, I guess I'll give it a listen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Aria Mummer hands the stubborn girl a Melody Box and begins to play a song. She falls silent after the last note fades.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Did my Ma ask you to bring this here?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is your mother the master of this Aria Mummer?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. I've never seen her with an Echo like this before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This song must be for her. I heard an accordion. Ma used to love playing the accordion.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did you and your mother not get along?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I don't know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not get along? It was worse than that. We had a big argument before she left for the Den.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She barely came home, and whenever she did, she'd yell at me for not living right and for not preserving her glory by becoming a Gladiator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But this song… she used to play stuff like this for me. Songs that made me want to be a musician.

Options.PlotLineKey: You did nothing wrong by following your own dreams.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know. It's just...

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wish we hadn't had that argument that day… I… I should have wished her "Happy Hunting"…

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I'm not crying! I just want to know who wrote this song.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you have any idea?

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are plenty of Gladiators who enjoy music, but none would carry an Aria Mummer around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But… I remember Ma once mentioned a musician friend she met at the Hunter's Den. Maybe that's who you're looking for.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Stubborn Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for bringing me this song. I'll... treasure it forever.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Aria Mummer's frequency is fading… We need to find Cratus quickly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On it… Hold on. Is that a person in the middle of that group of TDs?

Dialogues.Speaker: Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Roarrrrrrr!!

Dialogues.Speaker: Battered Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha... thank you so much for saving me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Battered Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ohh! You're the Champion!

Dialogues.Speaker: Battered Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May applause greet you! I'm Cratus. You here to hunt TDs as well?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Aria Mummer hands Cratus a Melody Box and begins to play a song.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cratus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The melody is bold. The trombone, bright. This must be a song for my brother.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cratus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My brother was like the trombone in this song: proper, forthright, and admired.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cratus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for bringing us this beautiful song. Did you compose this?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm just carrying out someone's request.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So far, it seems the recipients are all members of your brother's team…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cratus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could it be Pulkara? I remember she loved playing the accordion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Based on what we know, the composer is likely a Ragunnesi lady who enjoys singing and has an Aria Mummer companion…

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She sent a song to Ms. Pulkara as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cratus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My brother once mentioned in a letter that his team had a member from Ragunna who loved to sing and dance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aha! At last, a clue. Do you know her name? Was it a woman?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cratus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A woman, yes. But my brother never mentioned her name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cratus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There was also another survivor on the team besides my brother, called Aleus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cratus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe he knows something about her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aleus? Hmm, he's actually the next person on the list.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. Looks like we're getting closer to the answer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cratus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're welcome, {Male=Mr.;Female=Ms.} Champion! I still have much to learn, but I'll meet you in a duel in the arena someday!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Aria Mummer... Are you Grisoni?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... you made it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha… other than our comatose Captain, it's just you and me now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you here to reprimand me? I failed Strozzia. If you want to punch me, go ahead. I deserve it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strozzia? That's a Ragunnesi name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems like we've got our answer, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …I was in Galba's team. We were stationed near the Hunter's Den, keeping tabs on TD activity during the High Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We wrapped up a hunt that day and held a celebration feast at camp.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But something was nagging our Captain. After the feast, he ordered us to patrol the camp's perimeter. I had too many drinks, so I stayed behind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I heard the alarm go off, I rushed out, only to see waves of TDs rushing toward camp...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I ran to my team as fast as I could... I only found Strozzia, severely wounded and shielding the Captain with her own body…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She said she couldn't make it and told me to get the Captain out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why did I drink so much that day? I should've been out there with them… revelling in that glorious last stand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if I'd gone with them… maybe… maybe they'd all still be here…

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, Strozzia sounds like someone who couldn't fight. Why was she on your team?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She was our support. The Captain approved it himself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They say she was from Ragunna. Her story was that she couldn't make a name for herself there, so she came to Septimont for inspiration to create songs no Ragunnesi had ever heard before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She couldn't even play a proper tune when she first got here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Honestly, I thought she just wanted to act out some romantic story of sacrifice. Typical Ragunnesi.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, watch your... Forget it. Go on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over time, Gattuso, the cheery one on the team, started helping her, told her all about Septimont. Even invited her over to his place while off duty and introduced his little brother to her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pulkara was all tough at first, but she eventually warmed up to her. I often saw them playing the accordion together, with Grisoni as accompaniment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strozzia's music changed. I could tell she's grown to truly love Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So when she asked to stay on the team as our support, I voted yes. She earned it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I taught her how to hold a sword and the skills needed to defend herself. She said she wanted to write a song for each of us, not for fame, but to commemorate our time together...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …She must've followed the Captain out of camp in search of inspiration that day.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you hadn't taught her how to hold a sword, she might not have been able to bring Galba back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Is this the song she wrote for me? That clarinet… Such a clear and elegant melody…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this how she saw me? Was I ever like that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll be honest with you, brother, drowning yourself in remorse isn't a good look.

Options.PlotLineKey: There are still things you can do.
Don't let Strozzia's song go to waste.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …You're right. There are things I must do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need to recover the weapons of my comrades. I'm the only one left who still recognizes them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aleus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you all. And thank you, Grisoni. The melody of this song will forever be engraved in my heart, as a reminder of the person I am meant to be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, you're the Laureate! What an honor to receive your visit!

Dialogues.Speaker: Julio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is there something I can help you with?

Dialogues.Speaker: Julio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's been five or six years since I last saw my sister. I thought she'd eventually come back to the family business after realizing that being a musician was nothing but a pipe dream.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it seems I underestimated her resolve. Perhaps from the day she left me that letter, she was no longer the little sister who would hide behind me, while our parents scolded us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, maybe it was even before that, when she refused to attend the same school as I did.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I had talked to her sooner, or given her more support, she might not have traveled to Septimont all by herself… I should have reached out to her, asked about her life there…

Dialogues.Speaker: Julio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sigh... I can't imagine how much she hated me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Julio starts to cry. At that moment, the Aria Mummer begins playing a song.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This tune… is a Ragunnesi lullaby. It was quite popular twenty years ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah… this… this is the one I used to sing for her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm ten years older than her, so I pretty much raised her with our parents. Even when she was in middle school, she would come to my room to hide from the storms.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But… how does Grisoni know this lullaby? It wasn't part of our family back then.

Options.PlotLineKey: Because this was Strozzia's favorite song.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... She'd often play it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't suppose anyone would keep playing a song sung by someone they hate, would they? Your sister never hated you. She just wanted a life of her own.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strozzia's teammate, Pulkara, has a daughter who wants to be a musician because of her mother's love for the accordion.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sure Grisoni risked everything to come back to Ragunna and tell you that its master became a musician because of her love for her older brother.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even in her final moments, she was thinking of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Is that true, Grisoni?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grisoni embraces Julio as the beautiful melody echoes from its chest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see, I will carry my sister's love in my heart.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If she never hated me, then that's one more reason to live a happy life…

Dialogues.Speaker: Julio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe when the time comes, somewhere out there, our souls will meet again…

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the glow of Julio's tearful smile, Grisoni's body dissolves into countless specks of light, flowing like a river of stars toward the Resonance Nexus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're back, {Male=mister;Female=miss}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where's the Aria Mummer? How come it's not here with you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tell Tertia the story of Grisoni and Strozzia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa, so Grisoni fulfilled Strozzia's wish and its own in the end…

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you think it'll have a sweet dream inside the Resonance Nexus?

Options.PlotLineKey: Echoes that return to the Resonance Nexus will be reshaped into new entities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hope it can reunite with its master in its dream!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mom once told me they'll forget everything and start over.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That sounds really sad...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for telling me this story. I'll share it with my little Drake after I get home.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have a Drake...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes! It's so cool! One day, when I become a Gladiator, I'll have it come with me and watch it grow into a huge Drake!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I almost forgot… Here, take these, {Male=mister;Female=miss}! Mom said I should always thank people for their help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tertia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See ya, {Male=mister;Female=miss}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greetings. Is Mr. Galba home?

Dialogues.Speaker: Medical Personnel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... you're here to see him?

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. He's an old friend. I came by to visit him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Medical Personnel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sure you're aware of the recent unusual High Tide. His team came under devastating attack by Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Medical Personnel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Galba was seriously injured, and he barely made it out alive. He's currently in a coma...

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's terrible… May the Sentinel bless... Ahem, may fortune favor him and bring him back to us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What about his family?

Dialogues.Speaker: Medical Personnel
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean Mr. Cratus? He's probably hunting Tacet Discords outside the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pierrot
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. That's where we'll be going, then.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aria Mummers aren't built for fights… Better find it fast.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me know if you spot anything, Abby.
